title: Senior Back-End Developer
description:
Instrument is pushing the boundaries of design, technology and innovation for some of the world’s leading brands. We exist to help organizations look ahead, bring concepts to life and build systems that shape the future. We are designers, innovators, developers, strategists and dreamers, working together to build modern, digital experiences for brands with a purpose.

We are looking for a new Senior Back-End Developer to join our internal digital product development team where you will have an opportunity to create tools which support, empower and connect our rapidly growing workforce spread across multiple geographic locations. You'll be involved in the full life cycle of the product from concept to delivery; maintenance to optimization.

An experienced backend developer, you can architect and execute on medium to large scale applications. You manage and execute deployments in an efficient, organized and timely way -- always with security and efficiency in mind. You know a multitude of systems and languages well enough to tackle any site or product problem with the appropriate solution and are comfortable articulating your solutions and plans to technical and non-technical people alike. You thrive in highly collaborative multidisciplinary teams working to find streamlined and efficient solutions to solve complex problems. The user’s experience is always at the center of your approach as you crafting holistic and empathic solutions.

What you’ll do:

  • Build backend systems and tools to support the operations of Instrument
  • Release updates and support existing software built by our products team
  • Diagram and document systems and processes
  • Clearly communicate with your product manager and team throughout projects
  • Engage and consult with stakeholders
  • Do great work and be great to work with

What you’ll bring:

  • 5 years’ experience in back-end development / dev ops
  • Fluency in at least 2 of these three code languages: Python, Go, Nodejs
  • Ability to write APIs and build microservices
  • History with AWS and GCP
  • Experience with Containerized Deployments
  • Capable continuous integration strategist
  • Ability to architect medium to large scale systems
  • Ability to diagram & document systems & solutions
  • Positive, supportive attitude to remove roadblocks rather than create them

What we'll give you:

  • Money
  • Full benefits including medical, dental and vision
  • 401K matching
  • Paid holidays and vacation
  • A positive, balanced work life

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior PHP Developer
description:
We are looking for a tenacious, passionate, creative, software-driven individual to guide the design and development of our subscription billing software.

OBJECTIVE #1 Take on a project and see it to its end.

  • Potential Obstacles: We have many projects running and in a self-managed, remote environment, it’s tempting to pick up a new project (or three) before your first project is completed.
  • Actions: Understand the value of completions and use your tenacity to carry each project to the very end.
  • Results: Your project completion numbers in Jira are stellar and you have concentration available for the handful of projects on your plate.

OBJECTIVE #2 Work as a synchronous team in a remote environment.

  • Potential Obstacles: Working remote has many personal and team-based challenges from timezone differences, to communication and trust of your colleagues.
  • Actions: Develop deep working relationships with your colleagues to know what they’re working on, and how to support each other.
  • Results: The team culture is strong, Rebilly’s bigger projects efficiently move forward.

OBJECTIVE #3 Help your colleagues raise their skills with thoughtful code reviews and feedback on ideas.

  • Potential Obstacles: Your day will be filled with your own projects and priorities, and offering feedback to a remote team from afar can be intimidating.
  • Actions: Prioritize your schedule and share your unique knowledge and experience to help make your team stronger.
  • Results: Your team is more precise, creative, and their knowledge is deepened with your help.

KEY FUNCTIONAL AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY

  • What will you manage? Each teammate at Rebilly manages themselves, which means you get to pick the projects you work on. Along with that, you’ll be responsible for ensuring adherence to programming and documentation policies, code standards, testing, release, and reporting updates on your projects.

  • What will you contribute to? You will contribute to code reviews, feedback for ideas (including the ideas for other areas of the company), and hiring new teammates in the Product Team.

  • What will you support? Outside of generally supporting your teammates in the Product Circle, Rebilly is an open environment where everyone is welcome in every area of the company. You are welcome to support any project you feel called to participate in.

  • How much support per project? You can ask as many teammates to join your project as you need to complete the mission.

SOME OF THE PROJECTS WE ARE WORKING ON

  • Customer Billing Portal - create a secure and highly customizable customer billing portal

  • Auth Service - decompose the monolith application into loosely coupled services

  • Metered Billing - ongoing development of our billing solutions

  • Automation - integration with small business software

  • Dashboards - create reporting API’s for our clients' dashboards

APPLY!

Please send your resume through Apply By API: https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/7/

HIRING PROCESS

  • Apply By API* - https://app.applybyapi.com/posting/7/
  • Small code challenge (unless you have extensive open source contributions)
  • Interview with the Product Team
  • Interview with the Product Team Lead
  • Offer and Hiring The total process should take less than 2 weeks. *We are only accepting applications through ApplyByAPI at this time.

WORKING AT REBILLY

Rebilly’s Purpose: To innovate a better way to live and work.

(Apply with us and see just how much we align with our purpose!)

Rebilly offers a competitive salary, training and development, birthday lunches, and provides the computer of your choosing. You are welcome to work out of our Montreal office, remotely out of Austin (occasionally meeting with our team here for lunch or happy hour, otherwise set up as a 100% remote/work from home environment), or anywhere on the globe that you choose as a fully remote employee. Further perks and benefits are dependent on your work location of choice.

Rebilly is a Teal Organization, meaning our organizational structure may differ than what you’re used to, but we think you’ll be pleasantly surprised. In a very tiny nutshell, this means that as an organization we value self-management, self-organization, as well as the wholeness of the individuals that make up our team (meaning you should be yourself at work, and do the work that inspires you.) You can read more about it here.

ABOUT REBILLY

Rebilly is subscription billing software that helps businesses who need to handle recurring invoices and payments. Rebilly’s comprehensive feature set is built to help our merchants get more of their customers from the order form to the thank you page, and more renewals paid. We took lessons learned from years of experience in the subscription business and millions of subscribers and applied them to make our payment system clever, flexible, and easy to use for our clients.

title: Software Developer (Africa)
description:
We are an innovation lab in Washington, DC area working with start-ups and entrepreneurs to turn their ideas into market ready products. We're helping startups build cool web and mobile applications.

Currently we have a network of developers in Kenya and Nigeria that we source projects to. We need more senior level (5+years) full stack developers to work on our client projects, as we are growing fast!

We are looking for talented developers in Kenya, Uganda, Nigeria and Ghana only at this time.

  • You must have at least 4 years of experience in software engineering.

  • You have extensive JavaScript experience.

  • Have experience contributing, testing and debugging a complex web application using modern JavaScript framework.

  • Experience working with Docker, AWS or cloud platforms, serverless.

  • You have working experience in both front-end and back-end development, and are fluent in Full-stack JavaScript

  • At least one JavaScript framework (React.js, Angular.js, Vue.js, Ember.js)

  • Experience with traditional RDBMS databases, such as MySQL, Postgres and/or NoSQL Databases like MongoDB, Redis, Elasticsearch etc.

  • At least one server-side language (Node.js, Go, Ruby, Python, PHP)

  • Knowledge of Typescript.

title: Frontend Developer (Haxe) - Elvenar
description:
Our agile cross-functional team is searching for a Frontend Developer who will implement features and most importantly, share the passion for our games! Bring your knowledge of Haxe Development and your communicational approach of finding solutions to provide the best user experience for our players.

Your mission:

  • You contribute to the continuous development and improvement of one of our keystone games
  • You develop new features and improve existing game features with a strong focus on UI and UX
  • You are part of the whole feature development lifecycle with a commitment to quality results
  • You collaborate closely with Game Designers and Artists to implement new game features for our Flash and HTML5 browser clients

Your profile:

  • Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or a comparable education
  • Working experience in game development, ideally on browser games
  • Several years of experience with either Haxe / AS3 or JS
  • A good eye for details and a passion for implementing UI and UX
  • Working experience with MVC frameworks
  • Well-versed in design patterns and software architecture
  • Experience with writing browser automation tests
  • Know your way around popular scripting languages (Python / Bash / Groovy)
  • Solution-oriented and efficient style of work
  • Team player and a good communicator with fluent English language skills
  • A proactive and motivated individual with a willingness to learn
  • Passion for online strategy games and knowledge of relevant game mechanics

Why join us?

  • Be part of a great international team in a healthy and stable growing company
  • Choose your preferred device (Linux, Mac or even Windows) to set-up your favorite workplace
  • We actively support your further development and give you all needed resources to evaluate new technologies and participate in open source communities
  • We provide additional training budget to spend on attending conferences, taking hard skill courses or improve your soft skills as well as purchasing books
  • Our career model is set up equally for an expert in a technical career or a management path
  • Use opportunities to make your code open source and show your achievements at international conferences
  • We offer competitive compensation with benefits like relocation support, company gym, smartphone or tablet, company bikes, rooftop terrace with BBQ and much more

Excited to start your journey with InnoGames and join our dynamic team as a Frontend Developer? We look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV, and references) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible start date through our online application form. Maximilian Kaeding would be happy to answer any questions you may have.

InnoGames, based in Hamburg, is one of the leading developers and publishers of online games with more than 200 million registered players around the world. Currently, more than 400 people from 30 nations are working in the Hamburg-based headquarters. We have been characterized by dynamic growth ever since the company was founded in 2007. In order to further expand our success and to realize new projects, we are constantly looking for young talents, experienced professionals, and creative thinkers.

title: Manager/Group Manager - Data/AI/Analytics Strategy
description:
This career opportunity is available in our following locations: Boston, Chicago Dallas, Denver, Houston, Los Angeles

Manager/Group Manager, Data & AI Strategy - Advisory Practice

About Avanade’s Advisory Practice Want to create value with digital and turn your ideas into human impact? So do we. There’s one in every group—the person who dreams big and has the motivation to bring their ideas to life, even as others might roll their eyes and prefer to play it safe. Are you that person? One who isn’t afraid to break the mold and who gets inspired by the power of digital to transform organizations and ways of working? Because we are building teams of people like that to help our clients unlock the power they need now and own what’s next.

At Avanade Advisory, we are breaking apart the traditional process of setting strategies and goals first, then finding technologies to achieve them. In the digital age, there’s no time for that linear process. We partner with clients to accelerate value from digital innovation by being bold, imaginative – and fast. We think big and deliver personally. We relentlessly challenge, inspire, and support our clients and each other. Want the agility and energy of a start-up, backed by the resources of Accenture, Microsoft and the Center for Information Systems Research at MIT Sloan School of Management? Here you will find a team of people who thrive on turning ideas and innovations into breakthrough results for leading organizations around the world. Ultimately, we’re not just making business better. We’re making life better for our clients and their customers. If that sounds like you, you sound good to us. Find your next opportunity at Avanade Advisory.

Overview: Avanade is seeking Manager to expand its Data/AI/Analytics Advisory capabilities. You will support engagements advising clients at the highest strategic level with big-picture and tactical guidance on how technology enables a wide range of business outcomes. You must possess exception analytical, interpersonal and creative thinking capabilities. You will need to be entrepreneurial, enterprising and personable, possessing exceptional leadership qualities, that allows you to assume a critical role in the Advisory Practice with an ability to scale over time. The deliverables in this role will be of a Strategic nature rather than a software or technology architecture deliverable.

Key Role Responsibilities: Operating with senior client executives (C-levels, VPs, Directors), you will assist our clients in successfully defining their Data and Analytics/ Artificial Intelligence Strategy, Transformation Initiatives, Investments and Operating Models to support their business priorities. You will target initiatives to specific industries domains and at driving business value now and solving our client’s challenges by virtue of intelligent AI and advanced analytics techniques to realize the promise of building an intelligent business eco-system. As a successful Manager, you will: · Support the delivery of a broad range of Data, Analytics, RPA and AI related Strategy / Advisory engagements · Identify and leverage approaches, appropriate tools and methodologies · Possess deep understanding of trends and strategies for identifying solutions to meet client business, financial and technical objectives · Conduct detailed analyses to understand and explain client problems and utilize standard consulting management skills such as facilitation, interviewing, gap analysis, etc. · Identify, develop and document issues, perform analysis, draw conclusions and formulate strategic recommendations · Lead the design and delivery of Data/ Business Intelligence/ AI and automation solutions advisory engagements involving strategy, roadmap and longer-term COE models (Operating models) · Conduct quick value discovery engagements in Data & AI to identify applicable industry use-cases, help clients understand the effort, potential benefits, technology requirements and develop an opportunity prioritization matrix · Lead strategy engagements with clients to create clear and actionable strategic roadmaps and supporting business cases that both delineate a broader end-game, while also prioritizing quick wins with near-term measurable impact · Actively develop and maintain client relationships at senior levels · Enthusiastically contribute towards industry specific offerings · Demonstrate thought leadership to advise clients on Data/Analytics, AI and automation strategy and detailed use cases development by industry · Develop the intellectual capital of the practice by publication of domain-relevant points of view and white papers · Actively contribute to the creation of client proposals for consulting and/or transformation engagements focused on Data/Analytics/ AI and automation · Monitor technology trends and raise awareness of capabilities and innovations in selected domains of expertise · Support the practice with depth of experience and expertise in the following domains: automation, machine learning, deep learning, advanced analytics, data science, data aggregation & visualization Required Skills & Experience: · 6+ years of Management Consulting experience from a top management or IT professional services firm · Demonstrated experience interfacing with executive level clients · Willingness to travel 80% domestically · Previous experience working on multiple Advisory / Strategy workstreams/engagements in a highly matrixed external client facing environment, with Talent & Project & Budget Management responsibilities · Excellent communication, presentation and facilitation skills · Aptitude for critical and analytical thinking as well as the capacity to accept out-of-the box solutions · Autonomous, positive thinker, highly flexible and willing to work independently as well as part of a multi-disciplinary team · Experience discussing a wide range of strategic imperatives across functional, operational and technological issues · Practical Business Architecture experience (business / operation models, personas, process modelling) · Understanding of the Data/ Analytics strategy and COE definition; AND/OR; · Understanding of the Artificial Intelligence space, and the ethical themes for AI such as usage and effectiveness, fairness, transparency, or privacy · Bachelor’s degree in related field, MBA preferred Preferred Experience and Skills: The following skills and capabilities are central to the role, depending on Service Area expertise: · Cross-sector and functional experience highly desirable (Financial Services/ Healthcare/ Life Sciences/ Manufacturing/ Utilities/ Media/ Communications/Supply Chain/Business Applications) · Best of Breed Working methodologies (Agile, DevOps) · Data & Business Intelligence Strategy, Insight and Analytics (leveraging Microsoft technologies) · RPA/ Automation Strategy & Roadmap · AI Strategy & Roadmap · COE Setup and Operationalization Plan (Analytics, RPA, AI) · Data & AI maturity assessment · Process Re-Engineering, Transformation and Adoption

  • Sound knowledge in Strategy development involving areas such as Data Architecture, Data Hubbing / Integration, Data Modeling, Data Governance & Management, Data Quality, Data Security, Reporting & Analytics, BI Governance, BI Self-Service ; AND/OR
  • Natural Language Processing, Image Recognition, Voice Recognition, Robotics, Automation, Knowledge Graphs & Semantic Search, Genetic / Evolutionary Algorithms, Chatbots & Intelligent Virtual Agents, Recommender Systems, Fuzzy Logics

Interested candidates please visit: https://careers.avanade.com/jobsenus/JobDetail/Manager-Group-Manager-Data-AI-Analytics-Strategy/7677

There’s one in every group—the person who dreams big and has the motivation to bring their ideas to life, even as others might roll their eyes and prefer to play it safe. Are you that person?   • Change Enablement work plan generation, implementation and process management

  • Relevant undergraduate degree
  • Experience working in cross-functional and complex, highly matrixed teams
  • Outstanding communication and presentation (verbal and written) skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to be flexible, demonstrate critical thinking and work effectively in fluid, complex environments
  • Self-driven and motivated
  • Fluent in the Microsoft Office product suite

Preferred Role Qualifications:

title: Data Engineer Manager
description:
This career opportunity is available in our following locations: Chicago, Columbus, Detroit, Minneapolis

The Data Engineering team supports business decisions at Avanade and for Avanade clients through comprehensive data analysis. It collects, aggregates and analyzes data from multiple internal and external sources and reports patterns, insights and trends to Avanade decision-makers. Its goal is to support data-driven insights into business performance, opportunities for improvement and identification of root cause problem analysis.

As a Data Engineering Manager, you will collect, aggregate, store and reconcile data in support of Avanade business decisions. You will help design and build reporting tools, information dashboards, data generators and other end-user information portals and insight tools. You will be a critical part of the data supply chain, ensuring that stakeholders can access and manipulate data for routine and ad hoc analysis.

Day-to-day, you will:

  • Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen.
  • Analyzes current business practices, processes and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.
  • Support the planning and implementation of data design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance and performing needs assessments.
  • Delivery of architectures for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data solutions using Azure cloud data technologies.
  • Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams.
  • Design and Build Data Service APIs.
  • Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics.
  • Expose data to end users using PowerBI, Azure API Apps or any other modern visualization platform or experience.
  • Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes.
  • Travel as needed

Your technical and non-technical skills include:

  • Demonstrated experience of turning business use cases and requirements to technical solutions.
  • Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions.
  • Ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging, and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows.
  • The ability to apply such methods to solve business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration.
  • Mastery of .NET C# and T-SQL with the familiarity of U-SQL is required
  • Knowledge of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL DW, and Azure SQL, Azure App Service is required.
  • Azure IoT, Azure HDInsight + Spark, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Databricks, Azure Stream Analytics is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Python is a plus.
  • Experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning.
  • Experience preparing data for use in Azure Machine Learning and/or Azure Databricks is a plus.
  • Demonstrated experience preparing data and building data pipelines for AI Use Cases (text, voice, image, etc.…).
  • Designing and building Data Pipelines using streams of IOT data.
  • Knowledge of Lambda and Kappa architecture patterns.
  • Knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Quality tools and processes
  • Strong team collaboration and experience working with remote teams.
  • Knowledge of Dev-Ops processes (including CI/CD) and Infrastructure as code fundamentals.
  • Working experience with Visual Studio, PowerShell Scripting, and ARM templates.
  • Experience with Git/TFS/VSTS is a must.

Interested candidates please visit: https://careers.avanade.com/jobsenus/JobDetail/Data-Engineer-Manager/3684

title: Data Engineer
description:
This career opportunity is available in our following locations: San Francisco, Seattle

As an Azure Data Engineer you will collect, aggregate, store, and reconcile data in support of Client business decisions. You will help design and build data pipelines, data streams, reporting tools, information dashboards, data service APIs, data generators and other end-user information portals and insight tools. You will be a critical part of the data supply chain, ensuring that business partners can access and manipulate data for routine and ad hoc analysis to drive business outcomes using Advanced Analytics.

Key Role Responsibilities: Day-to-day, you will:

  • Translate business requirements to technical solutions using strong business insight.
  • Analyzes current business practices, processes and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for demonstrating Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.
  • Support the planning and implementation of data design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance and performing needs assessments.
  • Delivery of architectures for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data solutions using Azure cloud data technologies.
  • Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams.
  • Design and Build Data Service APIs.
  • Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics.
  • Expose data to end users using Power BI, Azure API Apps or other modern visualization platform or experience.
  • Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes.
  • Able to travel approximately 80%

Key Role Skill & Capability Requirements: Your technical/non-technical skills include:

  • Demonstrable experience of turning business use cases and requirements to technical solutions.
  • Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions.
  • Ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging, and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows.
  • The ability to apply such methods to take on business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration.
  • T-SQL is required.
  • Knowledge of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL DW, and Azure SQL, Azure App Service is required.
  • Experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning.
  • Knowledge of Lambda and Kappa architecture patterns.
  • Knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Quality tools and processes.
  • Strong collaboration ethic and experience working with remote teams.
  • Knowledge of Dev-Ops processes (including CI/CD) and Infrastructure as code fundamentals.
  • Working experience with Visual Studio, PowerShell Scripting, and ARM templates.
  • Experience with Git/TFS/VSTS is a requirement.

Nice to Haves:

  • Azure HDInsight + Spark, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Databricks, Azure Stream Analytics.
  • Knowledge of Python.
  • Demonstrated experience preparing data and building data pipelines for AI Use Cases (text, voice, image, etc.…)
  • Designing and building Data Pipelines using streams of IOT data.

Preferred Certifications: MCSA

Preferred Education Background: You likely possess a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or another relevant field. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice.

Preferred Years of Work Experience: You likely have about 3-5+ years of relevant professional experience. title: Azure Data Architect
description:
**This career opportunity is available in our following locations: Atlanta, Charlotte, Ft. Lauderdale, Tampa, Washington **

As a Data Engineering candidate at Avanade, you will use comprehensive modern data engineer techniques and methods with Advanced Analytics to support business decisions for Avanade clients. You can collect, aggregate, and analyze structured/unstructured data from multiple internal and external sources and patterns, insights, and trends to decision-makers. Your goal is to support the use of data-driven insights to help our Clients achieve business outcomes and objectives.

In this role, you will collect, aggregate, store, and reconcile data in support of Client business decisions. You will help design and build data pipelines, data streams, reporting tools, information dashboards, data service APIs, data generators and other end-user information portals and insight tools. You will be a critical part of the data supply chain, ensuring that stakeholders can access and manipulate data for routine and ad hoc analysis to drive business outcomes using Advanced Analytics.

Day-to-day, you will:

  • Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen.
  • Analyzes current business practices, processes and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.
  • Support the planning and implementation of data design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance and performing needs assessments.
  • Delivery of architectures for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data solutions using Azure cloud data technologies.
  • Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams.
  • Design and Build Data Service APIs.
  • Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics.
  • Expose data to end users using PowerBI, Azure API Apps or any other modern visualization platform or experience.
  • Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes.
  • Travel as needed Your technical and non-technical skills include:
  • Demonstrated experience of turning business use cases and requirements to technical solutions.
  • Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions.
  • Ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging, and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows.
  • The ability to apply such methods to solve business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration.
  • Mastery of .NET C# and T-SQL with the familiarity of U-SQL is required
  • Knowledge of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL DW, and Azure SQL, Azure App Service is required.
  • Azure IoT, Azure HDInsight + Spark, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Databricks, Azure Stream Analytics is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Python is a plus.
  • Experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning.
  • Experience preparing data for use in Azure Machine Learning and/or Azure Databricks is a plus.
  • Demonstrated experience preparing data and building data pipelines for AI Use Cases (text, voice, image, etc.…).
  • Designing and building Data Pipelines using streams of IOT data.
  • Knowledge of Lambda and Kappa architecture patterns.
  • Knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Quality tools and processes
  • Strong team collaboration and experience working with remote teams.
  • Knowledge of Dev-Ops processes (including CI/CD) and Infrastructure as code fundamentals.
  • Working experience with Visual Studio, PowerShell Scripting, and ARM templates.
  • Experience with Git/TFS/VSTS is a must. You likely possess a bachelor’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or another relevant field. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice

Interested candidates please visit: https://careers.avanade.com/jobsenus/JobDetail/Azure-Data-Architect/4019

description:
Avanade is a market leader for Modern Workplace and Employee Experience transformation and managed services. Our Workplace Value Realization offerings helps clients identify, design and implement solutions to deliver consumer-grade employee experiences to increase productivity, drive higher employee engagement and re-imagine their business operations. These offerings are focused on specific client business problems, industries and job functions.

As a Regional Offering Lead for Workplace Value Realization, you will be responsible for driving increased sales, revenues, capability and reputation for these offerings in your region. Specific responsibilities include:

title: Modern Workplace Market Unit Lead - Sr Director
description:
This career opportunity is available in our following locations: Dallas, Houston

Avanade’s ambition is to become the market leader for Modern Workplace and Employee Experience transformation and managed services by end of 2021. We help clients to modernize their technology platforms increasing efficiency, responsiveness and security, deliver employee experiences on a par with customer experiences to increase productivity and engagement, re-imagine their business operations to unlock new sources of value and remove cultural barriers that constrain sustainable growth. To make our ambition a reality we have established the Modern Workplace Market Unit which will be responsible for implementing the Workplace growth strategy and driving increased sales, revenues, capability and reputation. The Market Unit will have two strategic (advisory and technology) offerings called Workplace Platform Modernisation and Value Realisation. These are underpinned by sub offerings spanning strategy, culture, experience, operations and technology transformation and managed services that assist clients with Evergreen IT management through to identification/ realisation of new business value opportunities.

As an Modern Workplace Market Unit Lead in the Southwest you will be accountable for the overall business performance in this territory. Working closely with the Regional Executive, Regional Workplace Offering Leads, Regional Workplace Advisory Lead, Global Market Unit Leadership Team, Area Market Unit Lead, Talent Community, Regional Capability Lead and Global Delivery Network

You will:

  • Lead the definition and implementation of the Region’s Modern Workplace go to market strategy and business plan with the aim of establishing Avanade as the Workplace transformation and managed services market leader by FY21 and achieving agreed performance targets
  • Own and drive conversion of the Workplace pipeline in partnership with the Regional Advisory Workplace Lead, Offering Leads, peer Market Unit Leads, OG Leads, Client Account Leads and Partners including Microsoft and Accenture. You will lead by example through active engagement with clients and conversion of lighthouse deals
  • Establish an innovation ‘spoke’ with the Workplace COE Innovation team to help Avanade keep ahead of the market, accelerate R&D, source new capabilities and develop compelling profitable propositions
  • Adapt and augment global Workplace offerings, sub offerings, services, assets, methods and tools so they have positive impact in the Regional market. Contribute to the periodic refresh of the offering and methods portfolio working with the Global Workplace COE

  • Identify, secure funding for, and execute investments needed to enhance Avanade’s Workplace pipeline, client portfolio, capabilities, sales and revenues in the regional market
  • Manage budget against assigned Area/Region metrics; provide forecasting and sales pipeline analysis to support processes
  • Travel as dictated by the business.

Qualifications

About you: You are an experienced business technology transformation sales and delivery leader, with an appreciation for cultivating and coaching teams. You’re a natural business developer, with experience of growing a business technology services line of business through strategy, sales contribution and the ability to establish a presence within a target market and key clients. You have a track record for developing and growing long term, high value client relationships, with strong influencing and negotiation capabilities. Your professional skillset should include:

  • A track record of building a business technology transformation or digital transformation business through a combination of new logo wins and expansion of existing engagements using indirect/ direct channels. You will ideally have developed and cultivated C-Level client relationships in technology and business domains
  • A track record of delivering complex business technology solutions for client organizations that have contributed directly to, or enabled, improved customer/ employee experience, profitability, responsiveness, reputational enhancement and top talent retention
  • Experience of building, developing and retaining talented teams containing a mix of advisory and engineering skills
  • Ability to effectively team with peers in a large, matrixed organization, including experience with onshore, near-shore and off-shore delivery teams
  • Strong consulting / project-based background, including assessing and managing the opportunity and risk associated with large scale, complex projects
  • Knowledge of modern workplace technology platforms and services including Microsoft 365 (Office 365, Windows 10 and Enterprise Mobility + Security), Azure and an appreciation of RPA, AI and MR
  • Over 15 years relevant business technology leadership experience, including solution sales creation, delivery and business management, and more than 10 years of demonstrable people and/or business leadership experience, particularly within a consultancy or systems integrator You also ideally have:
  • Shaped, sold and led a portfolio of client engagements focused on three or more of the following topics: Digital/ Workplace Strategy and Transformation; IT Strategy and Transformation or Technology Platform, Applications and Services Modernization; Multi-Speed IT Operating Model; Enterprise Architecture; Workplace Security; Customer and/ or Employee Experience Transformation; business strategy and model design and implementation; business operations transformation (e.g. new product development, sales, service); organizational change management; cost reduction, culture and people strategy
  • Contributed to the design, assembly, pricing and delivery of managed IT and business services deals
  • Deep industry knowledge covering two or more of the following: Banking, Insurance, Products, Retail, Energy, Utilities, Health and Public Sector
  • Defined and implemented partner strategies that have delivered new revenue streams, capabilities and enhanced reputation
  • A Bachelor's degree in business or technology-related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. An advanced degree or MBA is strongly preferred, particularly technical (IT, engineering, or related). description:
This career opportunity is available in our following locations: Calgary, Edmonton, Montreal , Ottawa, Toronto, Vancouver

As a Solutions Architect, you will be responsible for the leadership, planning and management of assigned Digital Marketing client engagements and Business Development pursuits across Canada. This job ensures the right solutions and digital strategy for our clients in order to meet their business needs and enable Avanade’s Digital Marketing (DM) offering to sustain and grow our position in the marketplace. You will also hone your technical, management and consulting skills by leading large opportunities and benefiting from the vast knowledge of a collaborative team.

title: Analytics Architect
description:
This career opportunity is available in our following locations: Boston, New York, Philadelphia

As an Advanced Analytics candidate, you will leverage your understanding of complex data analysis and modeling to ensure Avanade project teams and clients can successfully extract value from their data. Working under the direction of your team members, this role supports hypothesis generation and testing, exploratory analysis, data preparation and ingestion for statistical modelling/machine learning/deep learning, building machine learning or deep learning models and model interpretations. You will be expected to make prescriptive recommendations for how to use the data to guide impactful business-decision making. Additionally, you will support junior team members when applicable.

title: Lead Software Engineer (Full Stack)
description:
About FamePick:

Founded in 2016, FamePick is a venture-backed celebrity endorsement platform that empowers brands/marketers to create authentic celebrity experiences on social media. We are a startup team with large aspirations to disrupt the way business is done in the billion dollar+ digital celebrity endorsement space.

Job Summary: FamePick is passionate about building out our cutting-edge SaaS platform, by providing over 2,500 celebrities social audience data across multiple social networks and centralized the data into one place.

We're looking for a strong software engineer with experience building services, pipelines, tools, and websites for all aspects of the target users. The products we build are absolutely vital to the success of the company.

Internally our team operates in a small group, picking approaches, people, and technology that make sense to help us achieve our goals. We value simplicity, agility, and utilizing existing technology and services if it helps us move faster and be more effective.

The right person for the role must be an adaptable software engineer who has wide knowledge on both front end and back end web development, can make good decisions about the best tool for the job at hand, find simple ways to solve hard problems, is happy to dig in to appropriate technologies, and traverse the full stack as necessary.

Responsibilities:

  • At least 5 years of professional experience in web-application.
  • Work on full-lifecycle for web software development, from ideas to production.
  • Be able to propose, debate, and continually improve architectural approaches.
  • Work closely with sales team and celebrity team to assist their needs on tech.
  • Maintain and life support both client and internal staff portals, address production issues and work to implement changes that prevent these changes from propagating to production again.
  • Develop high performance and user-friendly UIs for visualization of the data and control over the client portal.
  • Prioritize and operate highly available, large scale systems using Serverless Framework and AWS.
  • Build APIs and UIs to help make use of large data sets, infrastructure, and user experience.
  • Collaborate openly, mentor, leading, and influence other members within the team, across other teams, and users.

Required Qualifications:

  • Strong web fundamentals: JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5.
  • Experience with ES6, Promise, DOM, and SASS.
  • Experience with AWS or any similar cloud computing platforms.
  • Experience with React, React Native and Redux (Redux-Saga).
  • Experience with Node.js and server-side JavaScript frameworks like Express or Sails.
  • Knowledge or experience with one of the front-end libraries, such as Bootstrap, jQuery, Chart.js.
  • Knowledge or experience with SQL and NoSQL database.
  • Experience with Agile, TDD and CD/CI.

Preferred skills:

  • Experience in Management
  • Worked with Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Youtube APIs and other AdTeach tools.
  • Worked with a high volume of server-side data across different data sources.
  • Experience in a building data pipeline.
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow and OpenCV.

title: Cyber Security Operation Engineer
description:
About the job The Security Engineer will be responsible for ensuring all information and data on computer systems and network devices is protected and all networks and computer systems are adequately secure to prevent unauthorized access; investigates security alerts and recommend corrective actions to resolve and/or prevent reoccurrences; responsible for promoting information security awareness.

On a typical day, you’ll:

  • Design, develop, implement and maintain host and endpoint security solutions with guidance from Architecture, Compliance, Information Security, and other teams
  • Provide support to Security Operations teams to solve correct technical challenges related to implementation of security solutions
  • Assists in the investigation and documentation of security incidents
  • Assists in identifying security risks by participating in security reviews, evaluations, and risk assessments.
  • Works closely with the IT Security and Compliance team toward the implementation and maintenance of all data security-related infrastructure and policy.
  • Assist in analyzing and defining security requirements
  • Provide evidence as requested, to support audit and compliance initiatives
  • Assist with evaluation and pilot deployment of new host and endpoint security protection technologies
  • Collaborate with internal security architect to support the design of security solutions
  • Continue self-development of knowledge, skills and abilities
  • Develop a personal support network by developing and building relationships throughout the Information Security and other business unites
  • Develop effective teamwork and leadership skills. Your skills
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft ecosystem and security tools
  • Strong knowledge of SIEM
  • Experience with web filtering
  • Is able to advise business and technology on security best practice
  • Proficient in developing requirements definition, functional specifications, test scenarios/scripts, data models and business procedures
  • A strong sense of pride and ownership of the role, commitments and responsibilities
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills, with an ability to express complex technical concepts in non-technical language
  • High degree of professionalism
  • Logical and ethical decision maker
  • Excellent time management skills, with ability to prioritize/manage multiple tasks
  • Ability to work individually as well as closely with team or line of business personnel
  • Self-motivated, with demonstrated initiative and commitment for results
  • Great observational and analytical skills. Your qualifications likely include:
  • 3+ years of information security experience
  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or Business Administration or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience
  • SANS and CISSP accreditations highly desirable

title: Delivery Solutions Architect
description:
As a Senior Delivery Solutions Architect, you will lead teams to plan, analyze, design, build, test and deploy enterprise Microsoft technology infrastructures in the Azure Public Cloud. You will apply functional knowledge and technical expertise in the designing of systems to support customer needs and you will contribute to our vast repository of intellectual property. Additionally, you will coach, train, and mentor team members and customers. And, you will be involved in the selling of Avanade solutions, proposal development, change requirements, some marketing/PR initiatives, and developing customer relationships and analyzing the customer's business as well as some Delivery Solutioning.

You are involved with the following:

  • Azure infrastructure enterprise level projects that design and deploy cloud environments for hosting business application services
  • Designing, testing, and implementing application services migrations in both a manual and automated manner
  • Working closely with client operational resources in updating their on-premise practices to include cloud
  • Managed a combination of on-shore and off-shore resources
  • Working closely with application, network, and security teams to ensure requirements are reflected appropriately in the Azure design
  • Travel to client locations as needed

About you

You are a solid technologist with strong business skills. You are as comfortable working with a technical team as with client business users, and you know how to build bridges between the two. With your excellent communications skills, you are adept at mapping business needs to technology solutions and helping non-technical audiences understand the benefits of these solutions.

Your skillset likely includes:

  • Consulting experience with large scale migrations to Cloud Providers such as Azure, AWS, Google, IBM

  • Knowledge of infrastructure solutions, especially in relation to Microsoft programs, platform migration, system security, enterprise directories, and cloud technologies.

  • Knowledge of operation management, systems security, testing, databases and mobility considerations.

  • Working with global teams and offshore resources.

  • Communicating and presenting complex information to technical and non-technical stakeholders, both verbally and in written form. Skills and experiences you may have:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.

  • Multiple years of demonstrated experience in Systems Administration or Systems Engineering.

  • 2+ years in a technical position using Cloud technologies

  • Knowledge of Oracle and/or SQL databases

  • Linux (RHEL, CentOS) experience

  • Deep understanding of cloud computing technologies across Windows and Linux, with demonstrated hands-on experience on one or more of the following domains:

  • Azure Core Platform: Compute, Storage, Networking (core need)

  • Monitoring, alerting and logging tools, and build/release processes highly preferred

  • Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery models

  • General automation, Azure Automation, Azure CLI, Ansible highly preferred, PowerShell scripting. (core/highly desirable)

  • Familiarity with authentication patterns (mfa)

  • Familiarity with network topologies and technologies (DNS…) with emphasis on network gateway devices (ingress/egress)

  • Familiarity Web Technologies. (web servers, proxies, certificates)

  • Application migration experience (VMware) would be a plus

  • Demonstrated experience with azure cloud infrastructure, including automation/infrastructure as code.

title: Sitecore Architect
description:
Sitecore Architect

Do you have a passion for developing creative solutions to solve complex issues? So do we.

We have 250+ Sitecore customers in 21 countries and have won 17 Sitecore Site of the Year and Experience awards in the last four years. Join our more than 1,300 trained Sitecore specialists and be part of this global impact.

About you Avanade has an exciting opportunity for a highly creative person to join our quickly growing Sitecore team. This innovative group of forward thinkers creates impactful, digital solutions using the Sitecore platform. We’re looking for someone who wants to help lead state of the art projects and make a real impact with their work. If this sounds like you, you sound like one of us. You know how the right software solutions can help businesses do more with less effort. You know code inside out and enjoy putting innovation in real applications and getting real results. You want to be responsible for optimizing team and individual contributions to achieve stated objectives and look forward to serving as a potential Career Manager or mentor to more junior developers.

As you grow your career at Avanade you will build strong management, technical and planning skills. You will improve your abilities to think creatively, design turn-key solutions, and get along with customers. You will also hone your technical, management and consulting skills by participating in large ground-breaking projects and benefiting from the vast knowledge of a collaborative team. If you're dreaming about a career with purpose, we've got the role for you!

About the role

As a Sitecore Architect, you're responsible for the leadership, planning, project coordination and management of assigned client Sitecore engagements. You ensure the right Sitecore solutions and digital strategy are used in order to meet the clients' business needs, prioritizing the solution efforts appropriately, integrating them and defining cross-selling messages for the client, while facilitating efficient implementation of the project.

This enables Avanade to sustain and grow our position as the top tier Sitecore global systems integrator on the Microsoft platform. We’ve delivered more Sitecore implementations on Microsoft Azure than any other provider.

Minimum qualifications:

  • 10+ years of IT industry experience
  • 8+ years of consulting experience
  • 8+ years in Microsoft .Net Development
  • 5+ years technical team leadership or management experience
  • Ability to travel to the customer location (up to 80% expected)
  • Authorized to work in the US
  • Experience and expertise in leading a Sitecore migration.
  • Experienced in Sitecore CMS
  • Bachelor's Degree Plus. Preferred majors: Computer Science or related field Additional Area, Region or Service Line specific requirements:
  • Experienced leading large, enterprise level teams (10+ resources)
  • Experience working in a digital studio or digital agency
  • Should have deep technical skills and be capable of serving as an authority in at least one Microsoft technology or business domain.
  • Sitecore certification a plus.

Preferred Qualifications: Possess Microsoft certifications or shown experience in one or more of the following areas:

  • Web Services development using WCF
  • Silverlight or Windows Presentation Foundation development
  • SharePoint, BizTalk or Commerce Server development
  • Advanced data layer development
  • Azure development
  • Mobile application development
  • Sitecore development
  • ASP.NET or C# development
  • Testing & deployment

title: Cloud Architect - Capital Markets / NYC
description:
Preferred Location: NYC

The Avanade Capital Markets Solution Architect is a member of our Solution Development and Sales Engineering team that focuses on designing, deploying and testing highly scalable web solutions for Capital Markets clients. This individual is involved at various stages including pre-sales (25-50%) and works closely with the business and technical leadership to execute complex projects and solution deals. This role will work closely with the business development team to support deal shaping, pitches, and crafting technical architectures to drive a sale.

During project execution, you will focus on designing, developing, deploying and testing solution components of significant size and complexity. These include UI frameworks, distributed web services, real-time portals and mobile web applications. You will have key project and project leadership responsibilities and will serve as a career manager to other Solution Developers within Capital Markets.

You will be responsible for:

Pre-sales

  • Ownership for the technical approach and estimation of a proposal during the sales process.
  • Operate in a senior technology advisory capacity for our internal sales team.
  • Consults, advising our clients and internal stakeholders on the best uses of technology to solve problems.
  • Present technical approach and solutions to business and technical client leadership.
  • Design, scope, organize and deliver training events for both client-facing and internal team members to grow the enterprise web skillsets
  • Participate in and lead stakeholder brainstorming, technical planning and design sessions along with prototyping and proof of concept work.
  • Lead and review your team’s work across all phases (plan, analyze, design, build and test). Project Execution (Enterprise Web)
  • Direct efforts to define technical, operational and user requirements
  • Kickoff and lead development teams in large, bespoke web projects
  • Take responsibility for project activities including work estimation, planning, stakeholder management and project quality
  • Own partnership with cross-functional technology and design teams to ensure consistent, beneficial client interaction and solution delivery About you

You are passionate about using technology and the on-going evolution of web development to solve business problems. You are comfortable presenting technical concepts to both technical and non-technical clients. You have deep experience managing distributed teams and working within front office technology teams.

Your technical skillset likely includes:

  • Experience architecting web applications, understanding the pros and cons of various web frameworks, recommending an overall technology stack, defending those recommendations, etc.
  • Experience developing componentized UI frameworks using eventing models.
  • Fluency with Javascript front end development and associated frameworks (ReactJS, node.js, Angular 4)
  • Comfort in using server side technologies (.NET, Java).
  • Understand enterprise messaging paradigms and frameworks along with distributed computing constructs.
  • Experience in building cross-platform desktop apps is a plus (e.g. Electron, OpenFin)
  • Knowledge of one or more of the following: Azure/AWS web architecture, event based models, streaming frameworks (e.g. Kafka, Spark), real-time UI best practices
  • DevOps including best practices for web CI/CD, Docker/Kubernetes containerization, and testing Your non-technical skills likely include:
  • Experience consulting to external clients on complex projects, leveraging global teams and offshore resources
  • Working knowledge of one or more Capital Markets domains (e.g. FX, Equities front office trading, etc.)
  • Demonstrated excellence in communicating and presenting complex information to technical and non-technical stakeholders, both orally and in written form
  • Strong commercial awareness and financial intelligence (such as P&Ls, how decisions impact cost and profit) Years of Experience: 7+ years of increasingly diverse or complex experience Management Experience: 3+ years of management experience

Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, MIS or related field

Other Skills/Knowledge: Experience utilizing new/modern web frameworks: ReactJS/Redux, Angular, NodeJS, Java/.NET; Experience writing technical proposals

title: Technology Lead
description:
Avanade launched its fourth Digital Innovation Studio in New York City almost two years ago. The Digital Innovation Studio a standalone, agency-like, cross functional team of individuals, who deliver end-to-end digital projects from strategy and design, through build and on-going support and optimization. Studio team members work side by side in the New York office four days a week (and one day from home) on cutting-edge projects that add a layer of creative, world class delivery, on top of repeatable technology solutions. Our Studio is made up of UX and Visual Designers, Digital Strategists, Content Strategists, Business Analysts, Tech Leads/UI Developers, and Delivery Managers—most of whom have lots of experience working at Digital Agencies or Startup Incubators. If you’re looking for a fast-paced, highly creative environment, where people work hard and play hard, please apply! We’re growing fast, and we’d love to talk with you in person. We are looking for a Studio Technology Lead or Director to lead our team in the New York Studio.

This role requires a strong background with software engineering. Software Engineers are good generalists and problem solvers, who love playing with new technologies and frameworks, whether back-end or the front-end. They are passionate and talented technologists who are interested in learning new things every day. We are looking for a tech lead that has a diverse set of experiences across full-stack technologies including front end, enterprise and cloud-based technologies - .NET and Java. Even if you are experienced in other technologies such as Python, Ruby, Play, and Go, we’d still love to talk. Our products and customers are diverse, as are the tools that we use.

In addition to leading the New York technology team: Day-to-day, you will:

  • Work closely with the Studio Lead on new business initiatives and go-to-market messaging across the sales region / territory
  • Advise clients and internal stakeholders on the best uses of technology to solve problems, including the production of elegant, simple and maintainable code
  • Execute strategic engagements including: Architecture Design Sessions (ADS), High Level Project Design, Scoping & Strategy, and Organize and deliver training events, both client-facing and internal
  • Present technical approach and solutions to C-level clients and their senior leadership
  • Travel, when necessary

Our developers work in a very collaborative environment where multi-functional teams work together, with a single goal: to make it happen. They work to maintain an ego-free environment where talent matters more than titles, and recognize that great ideas can come from anyone, anywhere. Having an entrepreneurial spirit is important to be a member of this team, and our engineers are never afraid to take on different roles. Being curious about technology and its trends, and never forgetting the focus on the user's ultimate experience are part of our essence. We love iterating and doing better projects always. Having decent processes and knowing how to deliver software is important. Agile, TDD and continuous integration are important to us. We are looking for someone who is as excited as we are about these issues and who knows about good iterative development practices.

You'll be able to work on a wide variety of clients and platforms and collaborate in an environment where you can bring your ideas. There's plenty of room to grow at Avanade. What we are looking for:

  • 10+ years of experience in software engineering
  • 5+ years of experience leading and growing a team of 5 or more developers (foster community, recruit new talent, etc.)
  • Experienced with working in a large, multi-disciplined environment
  • Experienced in estimating projects with teams as small as 2 developers to as large as 40 developers, architects, testers and other roles
  • Familiarity with agile methodologies. We are team oriented with a collaborative environment that has good collaborative code practices
  • Experience developing and delivering elegant and clean code in .NET MVC, C#, Xamarin, JavaScript and / or any other language.
  • Ability to work on a variety of client and platform technologies, especially with fullstack responsibility (front + back);
  • Excellent in solving problems, passionate about technical challenges and hungry to learn
  • Knowledge of principles of responsive and adaptive design, translating them into fluid and responsive templates
  • Familiarity and experience with web standards, best practices for reducing loading time and accessibility / 508-compliance
  • Understands the concept of Continuous Integration
  • Experience with versioning control tools such as Git and TFS
  • Familiarity with Test-Driven Development (TDD)
  • Bachelor’s degree in a computing related field of study or equivalent direct industry

Interested candidates please visit: https://careers.avanade.com/jobsenus/JobDetail/Technology-Lead/3606
